crypto.name: Key Recovery
crypto.desc:
clam

Oops, Paul's private key was in the ornithopter when he crashed it. It's a bit damaged, but can you recover it?

crypto.name: Triple DES
crypto.desc:
clam

Before the Kwisatz Haderach, the Bene Gesserit used this oracle to predict the future.

crypto.name: giedi composite
crypto.desc:
aparker

I don't like Giedi Prime, so I made my cryptosystem use a composite number instead (I am getting lazy with these Dune themes).

crypto.name: haes
crypto.desc:
aparker

Much like the Baron himself, Harkonnen encryption systems are quite... large.

crypto.name: haes 2
crypto.desc:
aparker

The Baron got tired of hearing all of these annoying nonsense messages from the previous challenge. From now on, your messages will be short and understandable.

crypto.name: padding oracle
crypto.desc:
lily

The Baron used AES128-CBC with PKCS#7 to hide the flag. Can you recover the flag using his padding oracle?

misc.name: Echoes of Arrakis
misc.desc:
amanthanvi

Paul unearthed a Fremen filmbook which offers a unique glimpse into the lives of the Arrakis natives. The Ducal Heir has studied the filmbook and feels there is a hidden message he is missing. He has asked you to find this hidden message for him.

NOTE: flag is in lowercase and has underscores separating words

misc.name: Spice Harvest Data Recovery
misc.desc:
amanthanvi

As a Mentat in service to House Atreides, your expertise is vital to the success of spice harvesting operations on Arrakis. However, a recent sandstorm has caused severe corruption to a crucial spice analysis document, known as spice_analysis.csv. This file contains essential data on spice quantity and purity, crucial for ensuring the smooth production of the precious spice melange. Your task is to repair the corrupted file and extract the necessary information to maintain the efficiency of spice production.

misc.name: attack of the worm
misc.desc:
segal

the fremen are trying to sabotage the spice harvest and they need your help! spice harvesters have worm image recognition technology to know when to avoid a worm attack. luckily for you, a hacker genius got access to the pixels of the worm image, but you can only change up to 30 pixels of it. can you help the fremen destroy a spice harvester?

NOTE: the model is the same as the worm strikes back

misc.name: i love shapes and colors
misc.desc:
segal

in order to bypass censorship, paul atreides stole some dude's video form of aes. the logic is simple: combine AES encryption with a 256-bit key and geometric shapes in a video. password is muaddib

misc.name: image abomination
misc.desc:
segal

paul gave his mentat an encrypted thirst trap jpeg bitstream. the mentat was supposed to decrypt and give to chani, but he must've corrupted it along the way. can you help chani thirst over paul?

misc.name: llm compression
misc.desc:
segal

since computers are banned, mentats compute llm token outputs in their heads. turns out they can use them to compress data. apparently language modeling is compression.

misc.name: mentat tokenizer
misc.desc:
segal

ever wondered how mentats reason about words? i am going to claim that they use tokenizers like llms (please don't hate me frank herbert). anyway baron harkonnen gave the flag to his mentat piter de vries, but little did he know dr. yueh installed a backdoor in piter's brain. dr. yueh gave us the tokens, but we need the flag!

[2864, 35, 1182, 37, 90, 28936, 8401, 821, 2957, 5677, 265, 7037, 40933, 29415, 92]

misc.name: possible futures
misc.desc:
assgent

I see possible futures. All at once.

Our enemies are all around us.

And in so many futures, they prevail.

But I do see a way.

misc.name: the worm strikes back
misc.desc:
segal

once again, the fremen are trying to sabotage the spice harvest and need you to fool the spice harvester's worm image recognition! this time though, you need to generate a 20x20 patch to add to the image.

NOTE: the model is the same as attack of the worm

osint.name: bro thinks hes hans zimmer
literally arrakis I
literally arrakis II
osint.desc:
segal

snap can you find your second fremen target? flag format is UMDCTF{latitude, longitude}, for example: UMDCTF{38.9865489,-76.9451673}

osint.name: literally arrakis III
osint.desc:
segal

snap can you find your third and final fremen target? flag format is UMDCTF{latitude, longitude}, for example: UMDCTF{38.9865489,-76.9451673}

osint.name: lost on caladan
vlad pad

pwn.name: chisel
pwn.desc:
triacontakai

Help! Baron Harkonnen is forcing me to make a statue in the light of the scorching black sun.

Lend me a helping hand, will you?

pwn.name: mentat question
pwn.desc:
cephi

Thufir Hawat is ready to answer any and all questions you have. Unless it's not about division...

pwn.name: ornithopter
pwn.desc:
triacontakai

To learn how to walk, you must first learn to fly.

Wait...

pwn.name: ready aim fire
pwn.desc:
aparker

Firing your weapon when the spice harvester's shields are down requires exceptional timing.

pwn.name: the spice
pwn.desc:
relkochta

House Harkonnen's spice harvesters keep getting overrun by Atreides pwners. Help keep their riches secure using exotic techniques.

pwn.name: the voice
pwn.desc:
aparker

If you want the flag, command me to give it to you.

pwn.name: worm eat worm
pwn.desc:
aparker

Do sandworms eat each other? I don't know, but I made a challenge about that anyways.

rev.name: Flavors
rev.desc:
edwfeng

ah, elixirs, the sweet liquid flavor that brings a little spice to my life

AD38A5970B000E1500041F0B00011617AA85109204082D1485040326051D13012716BF081189AB990E2D0F182CA824

rev.name: Typecheck
rev.desc:
aparker

My C++ code won't type check. Can you fix that for me?

Note: you will need to set -ftemplate-depth=10000 when compiling.

rev.name: cmsc430
rev.desc:
aparker

This binary was compiled by an hand-crafted, artisan racket compiler, courtesy of UMD's very own CMSC430 class.

rev.name: reality
rev.desc:
emh

The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.

rev.name: realitys revenge
rev.desc:
emh

The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.

rev.name: travel the dunes... with OCaml
rev.desc:
assgent

ocaml_executable is a flag checker compiled and assembled from OCaml using ocamlopt. Can you rev it?

Hint: The flag is 123 characters in length.

rev.name: undecidable
rev.desc:
clam

Have you ever wondered what goes on inside a mentat's mind? This one seems a little...distracted.

web.name: HTTP Fanatics
web.desc:
tahmid-23

The official HTTP Fanatics webpage has upgraded their server infrastructure to HTTP/3. I still don't know how to sign up...
